channel.title: New models?
channel.description:
My models are zipped into models.idx so how can I add new dat files? I added the dat files to the raw folder but the items are still dwarf remains I tired to do this:
add model xxxxx addmodel xxxxx ::addmodel xxxxx

item.title: New models?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Draconian Mr.Draconian
item.description:
@Mr.Draconian wrote:

I used the model ripper before you told me and added my models andrecompressed them but for some reason the items till appear as “dwarf remains”.

Read full topic

item.title: New models?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Mr.Draconian:

Thanks sk8r,sorry for annoying you last night

Ehh, no worries. Only thing that annoyed me was because I was literally in the middle of a boss battle on RS (Yeah yeah I still play) and you got me killed. XD

I assume you got the models working?

Also, if you need to, there is a way to dump the models out of the compressed models files (the idx and dat). The reason I mention this is because you may/may not have the models in the existing files, and obviously you will need to keep them and add yours to it (if that makes sense).
So, you can use this decompressor to rip all the models into a folder, then place your new models + the old ones into the models folder for the compressor, and finally compress the models back into the .idx and .dat.
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/tools/279767-decompressor-sogotys-bens-model-compressor.html
Hope it helps.

Read full topic

item.title: New models?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arean1, post:8, topic:550283”][quote]I said in the LINK it talks about compressing.
The final output, the models.idx and models.dat, are what OP wants.[/quote]

Incorrect again. The OP just wants his new dat files to load. Yes, your method does work (along with my solution) So neither your answer is correct nor mine if you’re going to act the way you’re currently acting. Blame the OP for being slightly vague with what he wants. Also for your method he would need to decompress the models already compressed (unless he has a copy of the decompressed dat files which were compressed) then add in the new dat files with the decompressed models and then finally compress them again. So your method has its inefficiency as well.[/quote]
I’ve benchmarked and tested both systems.
Loading through the raw system takes over a second longer, at least. Depending on how many models you load.

So no, the way I suggested is not as inefficient.
Everything will have some amount of loading time, but preloading is terrible compared to loading the compressed models, and you need to stop suggesting it.

Read full topic

item.title: New models?
item.dc:creator: @arean1 arean1
item.description:
@arean1 wrote:

I said in the LINK it talks about compressing. The final output, the models.idx and models.dat, are what OP wants.

Incorrect again. The OP just wants his new dat files to load. Yes, your method does work (along with my solution) So neither your answer is correct nor mine if you’re going to act the way you’re currently acting. Blame the OP for being slightly vague with what he wants. Also for your method he would need to decompress the models already compressed (unless he has a copy of the decompressed dat files which were compressed) then add in the new dat files with the decompressed models and then finally compress them again. So your method has its inefficiency as well.

Oops. I fell down a well.

Good, it’s where you belong scrub.

Read full topic

item.title: New models?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

arean1:

1. I’m not your “buddy”.

Okay, bud.

2. Yes, I used the model compressor to compress my models into the two files. So as do you I also know EXACTLY what it does. However, using the raw folder also does the job, if he just gets the client to load models from the Raw folder (which it obviously isn't) then it will also solve his problem.
Why change the current system when he can just get the tool to make it work? That's a waste of time, and the compressed files load way faster than preloading anyways.
3. [quote]No where in there did I say he mentioned anything about compressing.[/quote]

Here:

[quote]If you’d look at the link I posted it talks about compressing the models into the models.idx and models.dat, just like he wants.[/quote]

Nice cherry pick lol
Read that entire sentence again.

If you'd look at the [u]link I posted it talks about compressing the models[/u] into the [b]models.idx and models.dat, just like he wants[/b].
I said in the LINK it talks about compressing. The final output, the models.idx and models.dat, are what OP wants.
[b]Fell[/b] free to continue.
Oops. I fell down a well.

Read full topic

item.title: New models?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arean1, post:5, topic:550283”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=669195.msg4474920#msg4474920 date=1425168240]

Are you sure your client finds models from your Raw folder?

Stop guessing answers if you don’t know.
He has a models.dat and models.idx

If you’d look at the link I posted it talks about compressing the models into the models.idx and models.dat, just like he wants.
[/quote]

First of all nowhere does he say he wants to compress his new models into the models.idx and model.dat. You can still load dat models from your Raw folder without it being compressed, so what I said isn’t guessing you ignorant child. As well as that he is indeed adding them to his Raw folder which is what he said, and as a valid solution to his problem I am asking his to check to see if his client loads models from the Raw folder.[/quote]
Wow you can’t read very well buddy.

Mr.Draconian:

My models are zipped into models.idx so how can I add new dat files?

Here he states the models are packed into a .idx file
As I’ve personally used the model compressor, I know exactly what it does.
It compresses all the models and then packs them into a models.idx and [/b]models.dat[/b] file. Yes, 2 files.

I added the dat files to the raw folder but the items are still dwarf remains
And then here he literally states the raw folder doesn't work. Probably because he is loading the models [b]using a different system[/b]

And then if you would kindly go back and read my post:

sk8rdude461:

If you’d look at the link I posted it talks about compressing the models into the models.idx and models.dat, just like he wants.

No where in there did I say he mentioned anything about compressing.
I said the post did.
Because, if you would look at the post:

[QUOTE author=“Songoty”]Someone requested one of these. I wrote a quick one in his topic, but I redid it.

Difficulty: 0/10
Purpose:
For those of you who still hard code models, this will compress all of your models into a single file (Well, two files, a data file and index file)
[/quote]
Almost exactly like what OP had asked for…
But wait, lets go deeper into this post.

Create a new class in your client called 'ModelDecompressor'. In it palce

And what is the code in that class he’s talking about?

			DataInputStream indexFile = new DataInputStream(new FileInputStream("models.idx"));
			DataInputStream dataFile = new DataInputStream(new FileInputStream("models.dat"));

(Just 2 lines from it)

It would appear to be loading the exact file OP was talking about.

Read full topic
